Title: Enacts the "standing is tiring (sit) act"
Summary: Enacts the "standing is tiring (sit) act"; requires employers to provide suitable seats to all employees where the nature of such employees' work reasonably permits seated work; prohibits employers from artificially designing a work space to require standing; requires the department of labor to determine whether the nature of work reasonably permits seated work; creates a private right of action for employees whose employer does not provide seats.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to enacting the "standing is tiring (sit) act"
